aboutProject: Utilizes React.js to display and filter through content, including topings and images of food.
Single page with drop down menu for ease of navigating around the website.
Web catalog that uses Python's Flask framework and SQLalchemy to store items in a database.
Utilizes Google's Oauth2 as a quick and secure way to register with the database without going through the a lengthy registration process.
Efficient way of storing items in an inventory without having to manually create and modify HTML pages.
Using the Google Maps API and Wikipedia API, the page features a map with markers that contain information on the location.
With JavaScript and Knockout.js MVVM model, created a filterable listing that pulls up the marker of the location on the map.
Convenient means of looking up sights in Houston, where they are located, and learning general information on said location.
Content of page is stored within JSON file, for easy adjustment of content without the need to modify the HTML pages.
Hyperlinks feature smooth scroll up and down the page, to make it clear that the user is traversing through the same webpage.
